website_summaries.verdict: Choose these texting gloves if you want a pair made for women and suited for mildly to moderately cold temperatures – they stand out for their good looks and supple feel.
pros: A sleek, stretchy fit, grippy palms, and feminine styling make these durable touchscreen gloves perfect for ladies who want to keep their hands warm and text at the same time
cons: Not ideal for very cold conditions
Text fingers aren't always reliable, but work most of the time

customer_reviews.title: I love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I live in a cold climate and need different pairs of gloves for different types of weather and different occasions. I have heavy gloves for -10° weather. I needed gloves that look attractive and will keep me warm when hopping from the car to the mall or for a walk outside on a 40° day. I know some people have said these gloves aren't warm enough for those things. I think that depends on what you're accustomed to. They work perfectly for me. They look very nice. I bought a medium, and that pair was really too long and too big. I have long, thin fingers. The small fit perfectly. I will order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: VLD

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen feature very poor! As in maybe 10% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: While I absolutely love the way these gloves fit and the way they look (they are really pretty on) the touchscreen feature (which is why I bought them) only works about 30% of the time. Its extremely frustrating because I already have really pretty gloves! I wish the touchscreen feature worked better. May be to late to return but if not, I will. I’m updating my review. Taking it from a 3 Star to a 1 Star. Initially I said the touchscreen feature works about 30%, I was guessing. I’ve paid better attention and it works about 10% or less. This is why I purchased these gloves and it does not work. Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: KRIS A KING

customer_reviews.title: My other fingers fit fine but the gloves were constantly moving on my hands
customer_reviews.text: The gloves seem to be cut wrong. The medium was to small. The large didn't seem to be correctly proportioned. The thumb was very long so I couldn't use it on my phone. My other fingers fit fine but the gloves were constantly moving on my hands. They kept slowly sliding down my hands while I walked. I had to tuck them in my jacket sleeves and tighten my jacket wrist straps. The material was soft but they didn't keep my hands warm in 30 degree weather. I can't recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: R. N.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these gloves for use when outside (running, soccer) during cold weather. They fit well, are comfortable, durable, and warm and I have found myself wearing them for daily use. They are a good combination of style and function, not too bulky yet very warm. They do run a tad large; I find the small fits with a bit of room and have worn leather and other gloves in a small to medium. I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joy in Midwest

customer_reviews.title: Not for really cold temps
customer_reviews.text: I bought these last winter for my outside runs in the northeast. I love that they’re moisture wicking so they don’t get sweaty like normal gloves and they fit great - very comfortable. The only downside and why I gave it 4 stars is I wouldn’t recommend wearing them under 30 degrees. I ran on a 20 degree day and for the first couple of miles I thought I had frost bite. Air flows through them a little, I think to help them breathe but then it doesn’t make them good to use on cold days. Will continue to look for something on really cold days but love these for my 30-40 degree day runs.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, but not right for me
customer_reviews.text: The gloves look great! They have a pretty design/color scheme and I love the grippy design on the palms and fingers! I bought these gloves for hiking in cooler temperatures. They are great for cool temperatures, but are not so warm when the temperature is below 45 degrees. Also, I found that I had swipe my phone screen multiple times before it would work. I've found other gloves that work the phone screen much easier. Nice glove, but not a great match for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Mild to Cold Weather
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. They're definitely not meant for extreme colds or anything, but so far they've been fantastic for walking outdoors. They are very soft and fit snugly. It has a good amount of stretch, so they hug my fingers better than most gloves but still provide better warmth than a standard knit glove. I love that they can work with my touch screen since I don't even need to take them off to use my phone! Plus they're stylish enough that I regularly get compliments on them.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Icy fingers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to run in the cold in nj. I tried them first in 50 degree weather. They were okay but I had a feeling anything under 40 I'd have cold fingers. I tried them today it's windy feels like 30. My fingers are like ice. Back to the search for cold weather running gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgety14

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great! They're lightweight and great for running or walking the dogs. They aren't immediately warm but once you get moving your hands in the gloves will too. I've used them in 40° F weather. When it's colder than that, the gloves are more like "better than nothing." I think if you had to you could out a heavier bulky glove over it depending on how snug the second layer is. I bought a pair for my husband because of how much I loved mine
customer_reviews.author: lilly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality gloves - provide excellent dexterity
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. I bought these for a Christmas gift for my daughter. She loves her gloves. They provide excellent dexterity. When she's out walking her dog, or in the car she doesn't have to take off her gloves to accomplish small tasks as she does with other gloves.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great value
customer_reviews.text: They're great! Nice and stretchy, comfortable fit. I have somewhat long fingers and these fit me fine. The touchscreen portion of the index finger and thumb are a sewn-in section that's ever so slightly clunky, but if you adjust the glove on your hand so that the tips are snug and nicely aligned it works great. They're not SUPER-super warm, but they're plenty warm for, for example, typical NYC winter days as long as you're not spending hours outside or anything. All in all a recommended purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kate O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Even difficult to fit hands will love these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have shorter fingers and larger knuckles, so gloves are difficult to fit. These have a slight stretch to them that make them very comfortable, without having endless material off the tops of my fingers. They are warm, but allow your hands to move freely as though you weren't wearing gloves at all. I have never been happy with gloves before, and am so glad i took a chance on buying these. I love them so much, I'm going to buy another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Throttle

customer_reviews.title: Great winter running gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are exactly what I was looking for. I love winter running but I could never find gloves that would keep my hands warm enough....until I got these. I tested them in temps around 20s and they worked great. My fingers felt a little cold for the first mile but as soon as I warmed up my hands were nice and toasty. These are very light weight and soft inside. The little silicone grippers are awesome when handling my phone and the fabric on forefinger works great on touch screen devices.
customer_reviews.author: Kasiulka

customer_reviews.title: They are wonderful for winter running
customer_reviews.text: Not too many issues with the gloves. They are wonderful for winter running, they keep the wind out and help insulate heat. I like to tuck them into the cuffs of my sweaters when I go running. The only issue I have had is with the fingers; they are designed to work with touch devices but do not always work. I have trouble getting the device to recognize input from my thumb, though my index finger is reliable. Overall this product is a good reliable and durable glove that is good at keeping you warm, protecting you from the wind, and keeping you in touch with your devices. I recommend this to basic users getting cardio, or to runners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hiking/walking glove
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect winter hiking/walking gloves! Just the right thickness to provide warmth without being bulky or making your hands feel awkward. These are not for the snow, but will work perfectly for keeping my hands warm while being outsude this winter! Attractive stylish details make them a fun accessory also! Very glad I ordered these!
customer_reviews.author: Sonnie_bunny

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought the gloves for mildly cold days. I was not expecting them to keep hands warm in harsh conditions. However on a day of 48 degrees, my hands did not stay warm. They are attractive looking but did not do what I needed them to do.
customer_reviews.author: SHERYL  MOYER

customer_reviews.title: They’re good. I found that my hands were getting a ...
customer_reviews.text: From my wife (I got it for her as a gift): They’re good. I found that my hands were getting a little sweaty in them yesterday but not enough to make me feel cold. In general, I find myself wishing that running gloves were a mitten-gloves hybrid. So that maybe the last three fingers could be together in a lobster claw to keep them warmer. But I like them! And I wear the headband too. I wasn’t sure I would like it, it’s very tight when I put it on but I didn’t notice that aspect running.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps hands warm and fit great
customer_reviews.text: The wife loves these. She always complained about the Nike brand not keeping her hands warm. She runs early morning when temps are 20-30* on average. These have been perfect she says. They fit great, she likes the little logo, touchscreen works. I think she may have thrown the Nike gloves away...and those were about 4x’s the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Glad I ordered the L for the finger length, but M might have been OK since gloves were rather wide across palm. Just easier to just take up width using sewing machine from the pinky finger down rather than exchanging. Otherwise very comfortable glove: very soft, warm, and allows good grip for carrying phone and a good driving glove as well. Glove too loose to type on phone screen, but allows me to tap screen to take call or access camera.
customer_reviews.author: a mom

customer_reviews.title: Seam ripped in one day
customer_reviews.text: Gloves definitely do what they they're supposed to as far as being able to use them with touch screens. They've been super helpful in the winter weather. I'm disappointed that one of the finger seams came unraveled and left me with a hole within a week of wearing them, though. It's easily fixable, but not something I expect from a pair of gloves that cost $25-$30. They should be more durable than that, especially after only a week's worth of use.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly! I have small hands, but I offered the medium size too be safe and they are perfect. I still have enough range of movement and dexterity to hold my dog's leash and tie the drawstring on my pullover hoodie while wearing these, and my hands never got cold in the 45 min outside in slightly windy, lots 30's weather in late November.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Great for running.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are fantastic for running. They wick away the sweat instead of letting it pool like a knit glove, but they cut the wind nicely. they're also small enough to tuck into a pocket if you get too warm.
customer_reviews.author: Lael Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for long run
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are awesome! First time wearing these gloves was on a 50 mile ultramarathon race in 35-48 degree weather. They kept my hands warm. Only time I took them off was to use the bathroom and I didn’t realize how cold it was! Touch screen worked well too. Pulled my cell a couple times to txt my location to family and didn’t have to take my gloves off at all.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic gloves!!!! Comfortable, soft, warm (without being too hot) and still able to grip things. Price was very reasonable and I will definitely recommend and buy again. The gloves do run a little large.
customer_reviews.author: Trudie W. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Began wearing these 3 years ago when I moved back to NJ from Florida. My hands were always freezing! During the cold months I wear them inside and outside the house They are snug, warm and I am able to do a lot of housework with them on. I just bought 2 more pairs, when they get dirty I just throw them in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. Betts

customer_reviews.title: Warm, thin, and comfy.
customer_reviews.text: Warm, thin, and comfy. I was disappointed in another pair of TrailHeads gloves that I bought, but I like these. I do have some issues with the touch screen ability of them, but that could also be the cold. I'm happy with the purchase, though.
customer_reviews.author: TaraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cute and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: First these are very attractive. I love the design on the wrist. I did not get these for running but for everyday wear. I wanted a glove that was not thick, good for driving, but still warm. These are perfect. Definitely warmer then the last pair of gloves they replaced. The touch screen is fine for basic manipulation - passcode, massages, apps, etc. But i don't think i could type in them .
customer_reviews.author: Ann M

customer_reviews.title: BEST gloves ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair, loved them so much I bought 2 more when i lost those. I now need one more backup set again. They look nice, fit well, are stretchy and comfy. Just enough insulation to be warm in most weather (but not when its super cold). I wear for activities, or just driving. The touch tips for devices works OK (better than most, I haven't found any yet that work very well for that).
customer_reviews.author: chester

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended for Below 40 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I ran a 15K with these gloves in 30 degree, windy weather. By the time the race was over, my fingers were frozen and I could barely feel them. The touchscreen feature seemed to work just fine when I first got them, but they did not work during the race - so I had to take them off to look at my phone (which may have added to the reason why my fingers got so cold).
customer_reviews.author: moolane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fall/early spring days on the trail
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great for what I bought them for! They are lightweight and were wonderful on the trail, temps were in the low 50's but windy. I can see where they might not be so warm in the even lower temps, especially with wind. I also wasn't really impressed with the touchscreen fingers. Maybe it's just me that needs to adjust, but it was a little difficult, swiping and typing with them on, but I do like the grippiness.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica71081

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Perfect weight for every day of winter use. Thin and flexible enough so they don't take up a lot of space in coat pockets or my purse and warm enough for almost every situation - they do get wet so not great for shoveling snow or snowball fights - but the grips also make them great for driving with a cold steering wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Cute but cold
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are very fashionable and the touchscreen ability is impeccable. However, the gloves are not warm at all. I used the gloves on a recent kayaking trip in central Florida where the temperature got as low as 48 degrees. The wind cut through the material and my fingers felt colder with the gloves on vs no gloves at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jazma Dobbins

customer_reviews.title: That said the ability to use electronic devices with the gloves on worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are meant for exactly what they claim--physical activity in cooler temps. While running in mid-40s temps with little to no wind my hands staid coolish--not warm and not cold. If I had only been walking or the weather colder, a shell over the top would definitely be needed. Also the fit in the fingertips is a little awkward as the seems are fairly bulky leaving excess fabric on the tips. That said the ability to use electronic devices with the gloves on worked like a charm. Overall not a bad product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the warmest!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 4 pairs of gloves, hoping one would meet my needs. I had high hopes for these because they fit well, looked good on, seemed thick enough, and had "sticky" dots on palms for driving and for opening car doors. I have traffic duty at the school drop-off and after 15 minutes in 50 degree temperature I returned to my office with icy fingers. Such a disappointment, because I have arthritis and need warmth. I will keep them as they will be good for driving, but the hunt continues.
customer_reviews.author: jcjones

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I used the size chart provided by the seller and ordered accordingly. Prefect fit. Gloves are true to size. I used them for a trip to Alaska and they kept my hand warm. Not bulky. They appear to be water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Indaknow

customer_reviews.title: okay, not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for two reasons--warmth and ability to touch screen. Today I tried them out in 36 degree weather and the touch screen part was okay, but the warm factor was lacking. Maybe if you aren't holding anything? I was holding a phone and a water bottle and my fingers were cold.
customer_reviews.author: S. Orr

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I have a cold hand and feet problem especially in the winter. These are the only gloves that have ever actually warmed my hands up. Unfortunately I lost mine last hunting season and now will have to buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: These wear well and survive multiple washings.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed a little pricey but they lasted through the season and kept my hands warm except when in snow. Size S was just right for me, giving me plenty of finger maneuverability. Nothing is as good as a naked finger on the phone but I was usually able to perform OK with the fingertip design. Liked them well enough to get a second pair for travel.
customer_reviews.author: AQL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, comfortable, warm, and cute!
customer_reviews.text: I wear these gloves for walking outside in cold weather. They fit perfectly (snug, feel like compression socks sort of). They are so cute! Love the pink trim, and like that they don't have a cuff, or any snaps or adjustment devices.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Hargrave

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of gloves, wish they were slightly tighter, but I guess I have very small hands? Otherwise, I truly like these and the solid black is what I need for work.
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.  Keeps your hands warm.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and warm. Works on a touchscreen no problem. Would buy again. Also, very pretty. Not snow gloves, but warm enough for Southern Utah winters.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca J. Bundy

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves for driving!
customer_reviews.text: I recently found trailheads gloves I think they are great very functional gloves. Very good with my iPhone and great for driving due to the grips on the gloves. They are super comfortable! Highly recommend! Thanks Trailheads!
customer_reviews.author: Starrider seven

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL CLASSY PAIR OF RUNNING GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: perfect! I ordered the large size gloves, I am a 6 feet tall man with more or less skinny hands; I had used many types of gloves for my early morning jog, but this ones out do them all so far, they are thick enough to not tear easily in case of a fall, they also sport cute little snow flakes across the palm and fingers area to ensure a good grip. the insulation is decent, could barely feel a thing on 30 degree Fahrenheit
customer_reviews.author: VINS

customer_reviews.title: Lovely
customer_reviews.text: I hate bulky gloves. This are nice and slim, let me move around, actually fit my hands and fingers, let me use my touch screens, keep me warm, are non-skid so I can easily grip the steering wheel, and are cute. Loved 'em so much, I bought a set for my sister. She loves them too!
customer_reviews.author: ty

customer_reviews.title: Get a pair
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are light weight, soft and comfortable. I can okay on my phone without skipping a beat. I wanted them and they washed beautifully. There wasn't any loose thread or lint.
customer_reviews.author: Donnetta

customer_reviews.title: pretty, wish it had little snaps on the gloves ...
customer_reviews.text: warm, pretty, wish it had little snaps on the gloves to keep them hooked together when not in use. Also, would like a key pocket. otherwise, warm and soft. my fingers are short, so the fingers on the gloves are a little long. The design is accurate and very pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Florence

customer_reviews.title: Toasty, cute, and best touch-screen effectiveness of any gloves I've had
customer_reviews.text: Only had these about a week so can't speak to durability yet, which is why I didn't give them 5 stars. But quality appears to be solid. They are toasty warm, nice and grippy, and the touch screen effectiveness is the best I've ever had. Love the design as well. They are slightly bulky as liners with my mittens for super-cold skiing, but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: trekkergal

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very good, they fit nicely and they have a good "phone finger." They are also very cute! That said, they are not quite as warm as I would have liked, but overall very happy with the purchase. As pair to use for in and out of the car, etc, they are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Rossi Szpylczyn

customer_reviews.title: Define recommend
customer_reviews.text: These gloves kick butt!! I ran in 30 degree weather using my phone for music. Was able to work my touch screen with them on and had sweaty palms. They fit really nice. Measurements are spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith S.

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced gloves for bike riding
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to wear for bicycle riding in colder weather. These are attractive gloves with a soft finish. The index finger pad for cellphone use has worn down to no longer be useful after 2 months of consistent wear. These gloves are not for hardcore temps, but are adequate for winter in the south.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands and short fingers. When I purchase a size small, the fingers are usually sill to long. These gloves fit perfectly. They keep my hands warm. When it was really cold, I put another pair of fleece gloves over these. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: DachsieMama

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and inexpensive gloves
customer_reviews.text: These have been great as a day to day pair of gloves because they’re light weight and as running gloves for the same reason. I have large hands and these fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: D Pendel

customer_reviews.title: Keeping hands warm
customer_reviews.text: Football game Gloves 🧤 I bought 2 pair one for my Daughter in Law and the other for me . When it turned cold I put mine on and surprised my Daughter in Law a pair and she was soooo pleased 💗😂
customer_reviews.author: BlkGal

customer_reviews.title: Great as long as not used in the rain
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for cold and windy conditions. But it is not water resistant, as these gloves quickly get damp in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Hindmarch Fan

customer_reviews.title: I really love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I really love these gloves: the fit, the flex, the lack of bulk, and the fact that they are rather "quiet " in appearance: no racing stripes, no flashing logos. They are light in weight, but good and warm. I'll wear them on the 3 mile loop that I like to walk in my neighborhood, and they'll also get to come along, in my pocket during my upcoming winter trip to Europe. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Midwest Outwest

customer_reviews.title: Maybe good for a 40 degree windy day
customer_reviews.text: Wanted warm gloves . These came up on a search for warm running gloves. They were not . Maybe good for a 40 degree windy day, nothing colder .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart gloves that actually work
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for "smart" gloves that I can actually use with my phone for years. I have tried many pair and none have worked without having to take my gloves off, until now. These work great with using your phone in winter. They are very pretty and the pads on the palms are wonderful. The pads help me from dropping things and have already helped with gripping banisters on slippery sidewalks. I highly recommend them if you're looking for really functional smart gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Fulcher

customer_reviews.title: These had a comfortable fit but I returned mine because they didn't keep ...
customer_reviews.text: These had a comfortable fit but I returned mine because they didn't keep my hands warm at all. I live in Indiana where the winter temperatures fall below freezing. Trailheads has excellent customer service and allowed me to return them even though I had worn them (that was the only way to know if they worked). If Trailheads comes out with another kind of gloves to keep hands warm in winter weather, I would give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: lady nio

customer_reviews.title: I Love these Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely have no complaints, their Beautiful, i love the design , they feel so comfortable, and i dont have to worry about taking them off to use my cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite running gloves
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite running gloves! Very form fitting and warm! Easy to use my Nano while wearing them, too. Sometimes during a run [when it's cold] I take them off because I get too hot. Even with sweaty hands they are so easy to put back on.
customer_reviews.author: Daring Young Red

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are perfect. Ran this morning in 32 degree windy conditions, and my hands were perfectly cozy. Being able to operate my running and music apps on my phone without having to remove my gloves was a luxury. I like that they are not too heavy, so my hands don't get too hot. Pretty as well. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Florida_Scribbler

customer_reviews.title: Great for everything.
customer_reviews.text: These are warm and sleek, classy and sporty. I have multiple pairs and wear them out on the town as well as out running and skiing. Wonderful product!!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret C. Turnbull

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are so cute and work amazingly well. The touch screen works with these better than any gloves I've ever owned. I work in grocery and use these to work my freezer loads and they work great at keeping hands warm and safe from cuts and other hazards.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetlynumb

customer_reviews.title: I've also started using them as driving gloves and they have been great for that
customer_reviews.text: I bought these initially as running gloves since the temps here have dipped into the 40s. They definitely keep my hands warm at the beginning of my run. After a mile, I end up taking them off. I've also started using them as driving gloves and they have been great for that. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vickygrrr

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size small, the gloves fit perfectly and are very nice. Worked with my phone just as they promised. Used them for a half marathon run relay outdoor temp was about 45 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Mona L Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: These gloves fit perfectly and are so cute along with ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit perfectly and are so cute along with the TrailHeads hat. My reason for giving 3 stars is that I thought they would actually keep my fingers a bit warmer. I ran with them on my hands the Saturday after Thanksgiving (Jingle Bell Run 5K), the temp. was slightly above 32 degrees, but my fingers were still cold. :(
customer_reviews.author: SAH

customer_reviews.title: They are quite good looking on
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit very well -as expected. They are quite good looking on, extremely comfortable, and absolutely great for driving. If the temperature is above freezing, they are warm enough. I feel the cold readily and am all in all pleased. And you can actually feel with them, pick up items. I did hope for a bit more warmth though for the colder temperatures as I do often spend brief periods of time outdoors. If you are just outside for several minutes, they are wonderful. Would certainly recommend them..
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Glennon

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm and tech-friendly
customer_reviews.text: I ran 10.5mi in 32 degree weather (including light snow) and my hands stayed very comfortable throughout the run. The touch pads work very well with my iphone (which was enclosed in a ziplock bag). I'm extremely pleased with the gloves and only wish I had bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love these I should of gotten the small since my hands arent that big I got the medium so they are a little long. But very soft and warm and I can grip things easily with then on
customer_reviews.author: sarah marie aden

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for ridding bike. Warm but yet flexible & able to control iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have large palms and short, stubby fingers (the dreaded "man hands!"). I sized by the length of my fingers, and they fit well. I use them for running and Nordic Walking in the winter. They keep my hands warm without being too bulky; and the touchscreen capability works well.
customer_reviews.author: Lafter The Fact

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but very light weight
customer_reviews.text: Oh they're lightweight so lightweight you really don't even need them the pretty though got to admit they're really pretty
customer_reviews.author: Berni

customer_reviews.title: great gloves - keeps you warm but not too warm, love the touch screen feature
customer_reviews.text: Pretty great gloves. I love that i am able to change the song on my iphone while i'm out for a jog in the cold without taking my layers off. They keep my hands pretty warm but not to the point where I am sweating. They are good for cooler temperatures, but not super cold ones. I love this and will be recommending them to anyone to wants to continue to jog, walk or run as the temperature drops.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Warmth factor
customer_reviews.text: I love the comfort and fit. I have large hands and these for well. They keep my hands warm at 35 degrees or higher. Not quite enough warmth below that. I am able to u user three touchscreen on my phone well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and useful
customer_reviews.text: This is as great pair of gloves. They are comfy and let you easily move your hands. (Some gloves are very stiff.) They have grippers, so they are great for driving. And you can use the phone the pads on the fingers and thumbs.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie K.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t size up
customer_reviews.text: Gloves fit great. I’ve ran in them several times and they keep your hands warm and wick away moisture. I would totally buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Sapenland

customer_reviews.title: warm
customer_reviews.text: I wore these on a cool day in the mountains. Not tested in winter. I think it's was in the mid 40's and these were plenty warm, and it was nice not to take off when I wanted to take a pic with my phone.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable and work great with a phone, grip my steering wheel fine.... I am not sure they would hold up to extremely cold weather or I would give a five star, but perfect for our TX mild winters.
customer_reviews.author: Plano Gal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Wintry Weather
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I'm training for a half marathon. They keep my hands so warm I find myself taking them off and putting them in my pockets, then I put them on again. I love the embroidery too.
customer_reviews.author: Holley J. Mangham

customer_reviews.title: Hole in the finger
customer_reviews.text: These are cute and warm enough for running in temps in the 20s. I did feel the cold and had some discomfort in colder temps. I really like these but they got a hole in the pad of the index finger within the first week of use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very well made and comfortable. I love the grippers because I use them while cleaning stalls holding a pitchfork, they're great for riding too. These are by far my favorite pair of gloves. I plan to order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: These are great for walking the dog on cold days, still easy to grip the leash. Keep my hands warm on windy days
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great Active Glove
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for someone that loves running outdoors and needed a pair that were light, flexible but also had good warmth. These fit each of those traits well and they're a great active glove.
customer_reviews.author: MG2506

customer_reviews.title: Warm, cozy and practical!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these glove to replace my favorite (lost) Head gloves, which are no longer available. I never expected to love these new gloves so much! They're incredibly warm and cozy inside. The palms have a rubberized covering which facilitates driving or picking up things, and the finger tips allow me to use my smartphone. The more I wear them the more I appreciate how perfect they are. I also love the pink trim, but that's just me.
customer_reviews.author: Girard A. Perone @

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I love my gloves! Very warm, ran a 15k in 30 degree weather and it kept my hands warm. My favorite part was I could use my phone without having to remove the gloves. Fit perfectly, I have long thin hands and got a Medium.
customer_reviews.author: Roadrunner

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not exactly touchscreen.
customer_reviews.text: They serve their purpose, but the touchscreen ability is shotty at best. My hand measured a large, but I went conservative and ordered a medium; I’m glad I went with the medium.
customer_reviews.author: CJ1299

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cold weather outdoor workouts
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the quality of the product. The gloves are nicely effective during cold weather outdoor workouts. The fit is not overly tight and they feel light weight. There is texture on the palms that allow me to wear them in the car as well. I definitely recommend and would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: idaho cpa

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor workout !
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves , great for outdoor workouts! Can easily use phone to change music or send a text.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy C

customer_reviews.title: Not for touch screens or windy cold weather
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are soft and comfy but not suitable for windy cold days. Also I was disappointed that they didn't work well with my iPhone screen. Took them hiking and it was such a hassle to take my glove off every time I wanted to take a photo, not to mention freezing cold!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany R

customer_reviews.title: NOT touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: I liked the style and that they're not bulky but the touch screen doesn't work at all and the image they have of the sizes was incorrect, at least for me. They were too big.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: These are 5 star gloves, but I had to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are 5 star gloves, but I had to return them because they were way to big for me and the fingers were way too long. You might consider sizing down if you order these!!
customer_reviews.author: TLHCoffey

customer_reviews.title: The gloves are little bigger than expected. They don't ...
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are little bigger than expected. They don't quite keep my hands warm enough, but I live in Chicago so it may not be possible to have gloves that will keep my hands warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Like them, fit better than others. I use them every morning when I walk.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: They fit well; serve their purpose to keep hands warm during early morning dog walks and while spectating at outside sporting events. I like that they are not bulky.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and Warm
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. I should have gotten them in large, as I was right on the size cusp...but they're very well made and warm for how thing they are. Stylish too, already have gotten compliments on them!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Cantlon

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for a 5k early December. Worked great. Was able to use my phone, kept my hands warm, comfortable... half way through had to take them off because my hands got too warm. It was 20°+. Need to try them in colder temps yet.
customer_reviews.author: Juliette Peters

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gloves; be sure to check for correct size
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great! A little bit of stretch, so they fit well; soft fleece lining is very comfy. The conductive areas work well on my phone. Be sure to check their sizing information. I normally wear a medium in gloves, but they recommended a small, which fit perfect. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carol F.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully Warm
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic for walking on cold mornings. They are lightweight and do the job.
customer_reviews.author: DGM

customer_reviews.title: Pretty & Practical
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit well and the touch finger works great on either hand. The pretty design pattern & touch of pink make a real fashion statement.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Dondelinger

customer_reviews.title: Warmer Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: Warmer than expected. Just a tad big and wish they had an x-small but overall pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: KnoxvilleSpartan

product_meta.title: TrailHeads Women’s Running Gloves | Touchscreen Gloves | Power Stretch Winter Running Accessories
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :9 x 5 x 0.75 inches; 1.76 Ounces
 * Item model number :FBA_S303P
 * Department :Womens
 * Date First Available :February 26, 2014
 * Manufacturer :TrailHeads
 * ASIN :B00G4CZUIA

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #54,014 in Sports & Outdoors (See Top 100 in Sports & Outdoors)  *  #4 inWomen's Running Gloves 
    *  #506 inWomen's Sports Accessories 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.6 out of 5 stars862 ratings
feature_bullets: 4-WAY STRETCH POLARTEC POWER STRETCH PRO FABRIC features a smooth, durable outer layer that is wind and abrasion resistant. The super soft, brushed inner layer wicks moisture away from your skin for maximum thermal efficiency.
TOUCHSCREEN COMPATIBLE- conductive fabric on tips of thumb and forefinger enables use of touchscreen devices.
SILICONE PALM GRIPS in a snowflake-shaped pattern enhance dexterity. These women’s running gloves have an attractive metallic swirl print on back of hand.
NOTE: Designed for aerobic activities such as winter running, these workout gloves are not ideal when temperatures dip toward single digits.

TRAIL-TESTED GUARANTEE – Your complete satisfaction is our goal. If you’re not happy with your purchase, let us know and we’ll provide a replacement or refund with no fine print and no time limit—nothing but our commitment to doing whatever it takes to satisfy our customers.
